titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Julia Ellsworth Ford Papers
titlestmt.author: by Joanne McCarthy and Jennifer Meehan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:52

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, scrapbooks, printed material, photographs, and other papers, documenting aspects of the life and work of Julia Ellsworth Ford and her relationships with literary and artistic figures of the early 20th century, including, among others, John Butler Yeats and William Butler Yeats.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Julia Ellsworth Ford Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Julia Ellsworth Ford Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Formerly classed as: Za Ford, Uncat Za Ms Ford, Za F754 1, Za F754 +1, Za F754 +G1

bioghist.head: Julia Ellsworth Ford (1859-1950)
bioghist.p: Julia Ellsworth Ford was a New York socialite, art collector and patron, and author of children's books. She was married to Simeon Ford, a financier and co-owner of the Grand Union Hotel in New York. Ford presided over a salon that included the Lebanese mystic Kahlil Gibran, Irish poet W. B. Yeats, and American dancer Isadora Duncan. Her published works include: Simeon Solomon: An Appreciation (1908), Imagina (1914), and Snickerty Nick (1919), among others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, scrapbooks, printed material, photographs, and other papers, documenting aspects of the life and work of Julia Ellsworth Ford and her relationships with literary and artistic figures of the early 20th century, including, among others, John Butler Yeats and W. B. Yeats.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Correspondence, 1902-1949. II. Writings, circa 1874-1951. III. Scrapbooks, 1903-1951. IV. Other Papers, 1881-1950.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Writings of Julia Ellsworth Ford, arranged alphabetically by title, and Writings about Julia Ellsworth Ford by Francis H. Bangs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes hand printed manuscript, illustrated with vine and flower border motif by Charles Braithwaite.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Ford's correspondence, clippings, and booklets about hayfever and ragweed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes book announcements and portfolio of color plate illustrations for Imagina , illustrated by Ford's daughter, Lauren Ford, and Snickerty Nick , illustrated by Arthur Rackham.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Snickerty Nick and the merry-go-round horses, a play in 5 scenes by Julia Ellsworth Ford and Muriel Smith. Snickerty Nick conquers the dragon, a play in 3 scenes by Julie Ellsworth Ford and Jean Muir. Snickerty Nick and Buzzy the pirate bee, a play in 5 scenes by Julia Ellsworth Ford. Snickerty Nick and the 3 bears, a play in 5 scenes by Julia Ellsworth Ford.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Untitled work about the relationship between Walt Whitman and Anne Burrows Gilchrist. Also includes correspondence from Ford to Grace Gilchrist, Anne Burrows Gilchrist's daughter with 2 photographs of Walt Whitman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autobiographical material, "Looking Forward: the Memoirs of Julia Ellsworth Ford," and essays about Ellen Terry and Isadora Duncan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Birth of the white rose. Blind in the sunlight, a play in 4 acts. Mystery on the mountain. And some have pets thrust upon them. The three little bears, Goldenlocks, Admiral T-Wee and the monkees. Also includes the cover title, Precious.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Magic Innerland. Narneen and her playthings. Little Loneleaf, belle of the maple tree. Princess Butterfly and Buzzy the pirate bee. King Nautilus Nole.

did.unittitle: Writings about Julia Ellsworth Ford by Francis H. Bangs
"Julia Ellsworth Ford, an appreciation, by Francis H. Bangs," typescript
"Julie Ellsworth Ford, personality and patron of the arts, an appreciation, by Francis H. Bangs," typescript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings, photographs, reviews, printed material and notes related to William Butler Yeats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes pamphlets, clippings, correspondence and miscellaneous material relating to "The mist; a little play in three scenes."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes press notices, clippings, drawings, and correspondence from P. Mackaye and Olive Dargan related to Ford's book, Imagina .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Correspondence regarding the role of the Japanese and of Japanese Americans in World War II, including a copy of Ford's letter to the President of the United States; correspondence from members of the United States Senate and Congress, state and local officials and religious, political and news organizations; a copy of Ford's pamphlets with "Supplement to Something to think about," and related clippings.

did.unittitle: "Concerning The Julia Ellsworth Ford Foundation for the encouragement of Juvenile literature in America"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, clippings, a booklet and miscellaneous material.

did.unittitle: "Julia Ellsworth Ford, a scrap-book of Disjecta Membra hinting at some of her doings, compiled by Francis Hyde Bangs"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Correspondence, clippings, promotional material, brochures, pamphlets and photographs relating to Julia Ellsworth Ford, Ruth St. Denis, Walt Whitman, and Yeats. Also includes a copy of "Isadora Duncan, the dance of the future," signed by Isadora Duncan, a descriptive bibliography of books and pamphlets by Ford, and a summary of Ford's letters given to Yale University Library.

did.unittitle: "Julia Ellsworth Ford, Scrap-book no. 2. Arranged by Francis Hyde Bangs"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Pamphlets by Ford, book jackets illustrated by Arthur Rackham, offprints of Simeon Solomon's illustrations, an original drawing by John Butler Yeats, photographs of Ford, Walt Whitman and William Butler Yeats and signed photographs of British actress, Ellen Terry and Ruth St. Denis.

did.unittitle: "Birthday Book," printed birthday record book completed in manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An illustrated "Emerson birthday book," including the names and birthdays of Ford's family, friends, acquaintances and other events.

did.unittitle: Consequences , clippings, ephemera and advertisements related to Ford's book
Ford, Ellsworth and Lauren, clippings and materials related to their artwork

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Ford's obituary

did.unittitle: "Last Will and Testament of Julia Ellsworth Ford"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of Ford's will, legal correspondence, a letter from Ford's son Hobart, named as executor of Ford's estate.

did.unittitle: Poems and greeting cards by Julia Ellsworth Ford

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes poems by Julia Ellsworth Ford, "The Bird," "The Peacock," "The Two Voices," "Things," "The Tree," "What is Eternal?," and photographs of Julia Ellsworth Ford's paintings. Also includes a poem by Olive Dragan.

did.unittitle: Photographic reproductions of Simeon Solomon's artwork

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes announcements for the musical production of Snickerty Nick, and advertisements for the music score by Charles Arthur Ridgway used in the Hollywood production of the movie.

did.unittitle: Walt Whitman, printed material and photographs
"Women Painters of the West," correspondence and related material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Ford's speech and poem presented to the Women Painters of the West. Also includes related correspondence with Orpha Klinker, associated with Women Painters of the West.

did.unittitle: Photographs of John Butler Yeats, William Butler Yeats and a sketch of George Russell (A. E.) by John Butler Yeats
Printing block based on a sketch of George Russell (A. E.) by John Butler Yeats
Printing block based on a sketch of George Russell (A. E.) by John Butler Yeats
Printed versions of writings by Julia Ellsworth Ford
"Pan and the spirit of beauty," pamphlet
"Spirit of Shu-Yuan Chang inspires China," pamphlet
"Supplement to Something to think about," pamphlet
"Tai-Shan, the holy mountain in Shan-tung," pamphlet
"The temple of the universal spirit," pamphlet
Photographs of children, dancers, and friends of Julia Ellsworth Ford, including Kahlil Gibran
